column11: Review Text

column8: Good to combine with st clairs
column11: In combination with the St Clairs case a nice trip...always depends heavily on the water level if it is worth going here

It flowed down like a long white curtain until it reached a terrace that was midway. Then it changed its course a little and continued to flow down on its second drop. The entire picture had a mesmerizing effect. Devon Falls was full with all the rains that has been falling to its catchment area. View from the lookout was a bit hindered by the growth of the trees on the embankment. Nevertheless, it was a fascinating picture to gaze at.
It's one of the waterfalls you'll come across in Sri Lanka. Very pretty but nothing fancy. You definitely don't go to Sri Lanka to see the falls, but if you're in the area, spend a few minutes there.
A fantastic viewpoint for not only Devon Falls but also for the surrounding area when you can enjoy some stunning views, well worth a stop to enjoy the vista!

First things first. There are two viewing points. First one when you travel from the side of Hatton doesn't grant the full view of the falls. But the effect of  the this spectacular falls seen through the thick foliage has it's merits. For a fuller view its the next viewing spot a few hundred meters ahead that would be suitable.

column8: For me, it was enough to check the waterfall out from a parking lot
column11: Not sure how is it with hiking to get to the waterfall or so, but I saw it from a parking lot of Mlesna Tea Castle and that was enough for me.
A Beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka situated in Colombo - Hatton- Nuwara Eliya route. There is a viewpoint on the roadside where you can enjoy the view.
You can have a good view of this waterfall from the road. There are two viewing points. I heard there is a path to go near the fall.

column8: Wonder full waterfall in Sri Lanka
column11: Wonder full waterfall in Sri Lanka situated in Colombo Nuwaraeliya main road. There is a viewpoint in road side where you can enjoy the view

We stopped at this viewpoint on our way from Kandy to Nuwara Eliya. The views are breathtaking and span across 3 waterfalls and a large lake. If you walk through the little crafts shop in the parking lot, you will find a stair case at the back which leads to a rooftop viewing point. The views from there are the best! Within about a 5 minutes drive from there, is the Ramboda Waterfall where a hotel is located. If you walk to the bottom floor you can access the trail which leads to the Waterfall itself and have lunch at the restaurant afterwards.
This is another superb location to relax for some time via Hatton Road on a journey to Nuwara Eliya..
This water fall can be viewed from the main road. It has a very long drop & very spectacular to keep watching.

Waterfall can be seen from Devon Waterfalls viewing platform from very far distance surrounded with greens. It is too far to appreciate the beauty of the waterfall, hence it was a little underwhelming for us. Nevertheless, the surrounding views is quite beautiful and peaceful, which worth for a short stopover. Hiring driver is necessary and we engaged “BLUE HAVEN TOURS” with reasonable price and superb driver named “Mr Sugath”.

There are two falls almost next to each other: ST Claire and Devon Falls. Our recommendation is to start with St Claire with a quick photo stop and save your energy for Devon Falls. When you arrive to the falls car park go down on the steps of the temple and keep carry on going down on the thousand steps... the forest walk is easy, brings you to an almost direct view of Devon Falls. Peaceful walk for about 45 minutes down and back Definitely worth visiting Enjoy
at 350 plus feet and loads of water year round ,this waterfall is one that ranks high among the thousand plus cascades in the island
When we drive From Adams peak to Nuwara  Eliya on the way we can see this water falls.we not go close to there but we can see it on the road.
Worth a stop and a couple of photos. The landscape here is spectacular. We stopped by at an observation deck. to catch a view  of this falls

Located within view of the Tea Castle on Highway 7, the falls was named after a pioneer coffee planter. It is 97m or 318’ high. It is known as the ‘Veil of the Valley’. A tiered waterfall, it has three drops. There is a trail should you want to get closer and have the time. The best viewing area is actually up the road from the Tea Castle in the direction of Nuwara Eliya.
This is a useful stop if coming to Nuwara Eliya using the A7 via Hatton.  The view and falls are very beautoful.
Well worth adding this onto the list of places for a quick stop. Gorgeous views of Devon Falls from the road so don’t need to digress from your journey. Beautiful!
Devon falls can be seen from the main road to Nuwaraeliya as well as from the railway line. There is an observation deck in front of St Clair's Tea Cup, so you can get nice photos from there.

Devon is the most and popular water fall way to Nuwaraeliya near by Thakawakele. Very close to St Claire water fall. Travellers are loving Devon. We can see Devon from tea castle. This is the one season can see beauty of Devon's.

A short drive from Hatton and worth stopping at the viewpoint beside the road. Mlesna tea castle restaurant is opposite for a meal too. Although you get a glimpse of these falls from the train, you can't get a good photo without driving there.
If travelling from Colombo to Nuwara Eliya via Thalawakelle, this is a great place to see..just by the side of the road. Easily seen from the road itself.

Devon waterfall is in Sri Lanka in Talawakele Nuwara Eliya district. Falls is formed by Kotmale Oya a tributary of Mahaweli river. Falls is 97 meters in height and it’s a very beautiful site. If you travel on Avissawella Nuwara Eliya high way make sure to stop at Devon Falls to see.

just stopped for few minutes while passing by on our way to Nuwara Eliya, there is a small path to decent down to reach to the bottom of the waterfall which is my next time plan though, but the view is very satisfying from the main road,
Beautiful water fall. However the day we visited, it seems to be less rain  in up country and not much water.
This is another waterfall you will pass on your way to Nuwara Eliya. The viewpoint gives you the possibility to look at it from distance
Its a very beautiful waterfall surrounded by fully green nature. Close to Nuwara Eliya. Very calm place. St. Clair falls also near by.
Worth to watch on the way of hill country. you can take some amazing capture different way. One of beautiful waterfall in island.

A good place to see a peace of mind waterfall and also from the view point more then that you have way of going towards a temple Hindu kovil ( pathana kovil) so you can walk for some minutes and see a closer view of Devon waterfall

Our taxi driver  stopped to let us look and take pictures when we were travelling Dalhousie to Mirissa. Beautiful views, but beware, a long argument between someone selling tickets and our taxi driver ensued. We didn't pay in the end.

We took a 10 min break on the way down from Nuwara Eliya. The falls are about 281 feet however they are so far away from the viewing platform and partly obscured by nearby tress that you could not get a good photo. You won't miss much if you do not stop.

There are 2 view points besides the roads to see the fall. At the view points please be aware of Monkeys. There are huge number of monkeys all around the place. Be careful with your glasses, camera , mobile phone food and drinks.
This falls is simply too far from the stopping point to see much.  Trees obscured much of the view.  Still, worth a quick stop.
Loacted close to Hatton town. Visit there and do not forget to buy a spectacular art work, if he was there.
Good fall and stopover on the way. It is little distant from the main road but has good view. Check it out.
On the lower route to Nuwara Eliya. Good views from the roadside lookout point, which also has a local restaurant area below.
We visited the water fall with children. Due to heavy rain ‘s water fall is very beautiful. Lovely site.

We were reading blogs to know how we could cet closer to devon waterfall but couldn't find anything. When we went there we tried to find our way to have a closer look so when we jumped off the bus at the first view point we took a look at google maps and found that there is a second view point at 20min walk from the first one, we get there and we said we'll walk again just to see where we can go. About 10min walk later, we found an ancient temple, we entered and start descending the stairs at the left side. It was a beautiful walk that we had there, we saw a cute fawn and we could see the waterfall from a bit closer.
This waterfall was a bit late down as you cannot reach nearby but you can enjoy the beauty of it from the road itself so save some time at the same time.
Did not see from up close but viewed it from a conveniently constructed roadside viewpoint. Very picturesque with a stunning backdrop
Another beautiful waterfalls surounded by hills and amazing greenery and a castle. You can watch is from road itself and save some time from going to closer

This is such a beautiful place ...and just seems so serine to see a flush of white water in between the lush green mountains It was drilling when we stopped there ... You can rent a scooter or a bike to ride from Kandy or Hanton to NE.
Nice place to stop for a look, just a waterfall really but would probably be more spectacular in the wet season
This is a another very beautiful water fall by the road side. You can see it from the main road.A good spot to stop and have break.
We stopped at both viewpoint on the way from N.Eliya to Hatton. Lot of water at this time of the year.
A must see if you are travelling between Hatton and Talawakelle.  It is a joy to see the water flow!!!
This is a defiantly a great waterfall to enjoy. You can see it well from the nearby view points . The surrounding area is beautiful .

Devon Falls is one of the most popular waterfall in the country specially due its clear view from the popular Hatton Nuwara Eliya Road. The best view is from Dimbula where a special viewpoint is located with parking facilities. On the other side of the road is the famous Mlesna Tea Center where you could have a fresh cup of tea could be had. Almost Everybody who travels on this road to Nuwara Eliya is bound to at least break rest here before continuing the journey.

It is worth to stop and watch this amazing view. I saw many waterfall during my trip, however this view is unbelievable. In our way from Nawaraelia to Bantota you can stop in the road and enjoy this amazing view

Can see Devon falls beautifully from here. But from somewhat far. Ample space for parking. A great place to pull over, spend some time and take snaps on the way to Nuwara-Eliya or the way back to Colombo. If you are interested, there is also a nice restaurant nearby with great scenery and very good food, specially to have a tea with a tasty piece of cake.
Greenary and waterfall is the best combination of all time. Wonderful place for family and friends . Excellent
nice place to get relax, I had to go with my friends and had a lot of fun. it was a great trip for us. and enjoyed well.

Compared to the St Clairs Falls,Talawakelle  which is down to a sad trickle Devon Falls is still seen as  having  full spate .Sometimes the water flows brown after a shower due to deforestation  and/or land clearing for potato/tea in the upper catchment . A quick stop over for a look on the Talawakelle  is so refreshing to the eyes.
As we were driving, we stopped to see various waterfalls, a lake and forested countryside.  Worth the stop especially if weather is clear.

If you're going to Nuwara Eliya via Hatton, then this is a must stop location to have some fresh air and see the beauty of the majestic waterfall. There is a special parking area for vehicles, therefore don't need to worry about parking. Watch out for people trying to sell fruits and other items. Be careful if you buy as they may try to fool you.

We took a bus from Hatton to the Devon fall viewpoint. A little walk down the road, untill you reach a tiny temple(see foto). From there go down on the staircase, it takes around 15minutes to te viewpoint. During the walk you can see the wwaterfall several times.

The fall is located far from the hatton main road. But the view is nice as have parking space to stop and grab few photographs on your way. I always stop and spend few minutes with the view here, on my way.
We went back to Kandy via Hatton road and this was on the way back and can be seen from the main road itself.

This water fall can be seen between Hatton and Thalawakele cities near Pathana junction. There are 2 view points on the road, but you can get the best view from the first point when coming from Hatton.
This is a nice fall but bit far from the view point. Still worth the visit and it is close to St Clair's Falls. Unlike St Clair's Falls this fall is constant and the water never gets diverted.
its full and full beautiful place. cool place natural view. with your friends or family this place is suitable to travel.
If you are in the area this a Beautiful waterfall well worth a quick stop and a few photos or selfies.

This was one of the best part of our trip. The restaurant was right at the nice water fall. Its a steep slope from the main road for about 50 metres where the hotel is situated and then another 100 metres of steps to the fall. Nice good view of the water fall. The restaurant was awesome with real good food. Variety of fish and chicken and the Buffet was well laid out. Overall a good two and half hours of time well spent there

This was my favourite journey the scenery was fantastic. Worth stopping at the waterfall but pull up past near the bar and walk back get your photos then have drink and use the facilities . A must in a van / car just to see the senery.

For the weary Traveller or driver after driving on a climb this is the place to relax with an excellent Tea with the famous chocoloate cake or a hot spicy Chinese roll. A nice garden to unwind, the Devon waterfall opposite and the cool climate are all the ingredients of a good holiday in the hills. The toilets are clean and we'll maintained. A highly recommended stop.
It is easy to stop on the road at the number of vantage points for photos. Waterfall is beautiful and you can see everything from the road.

There are viewpoints from the main road. We went to the top side of the falls. Then came back to the main road view points. We went to St Clair Tea Center which was pretty good location to have tea and snacks. We bought some tea that was really good.
Like most waterfalls in Sri-Lanka, this water fall  too is beautiful, made it more beautiful due to heavy rains. Good for photographs.
We didn't actually hike down to the Devon Falls themselves, but rather pulled off Hatton-Nuwara Eliya Road to the view point and were able to take some photos in from of the falls.
The Devon Falls can be viewed from the Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road along with a number of other water falls. Makes for a spectacular drive up-country.
This water fall can be viewed from the Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road. Remember to put the shutters up when leaving your car at the viewing point as the monkeys are waiting to get in.
If the St. Clair falls is spread out, this one is tall and narrow. Behind are the evergreen tea estates. If it rains, have a cup of tea nearby so that the sun shines again.

Beautiful and a must see for anyone who enjoys a water fall!! It was really nice when we went there as it was just after a rain. I think in the dry season, this may not be as nice as in the rainy season. Suggest anyone to go see, very pretty!
We stopped here en route to Nuweraeliya. A panoramic view. We went to the adjoining tea shop and whilst sipping hot very tasty  tea we could watch her beauty from a higher ground.

Both waterfalls are spectacular and worth a stop on the way to/from Nuwara Eliya. Our experience was enhanced by a cup of Ceylon Tea (and some chocolate cake) at Devon Bungalow, across the road from the viewing stop for Devon Falls.
Can have a good look at it from the road above. Easily accessible by the road to have a good look at it.
Unexpected Great view , beautifull and all..worth passing by ( anyways since its onee the way down from nuwara ) . Still its not magistic in size...its just picturistic

Devon Falls looked beautiful from the view point. Not very far from St. Clair's Falls and  not spread like St Clair but more beautiful. Water falls from quite high up of the hills and goes down quite low. It looks amazing. The surrounding hills, roads and a tea castle gives it a wonderful surrounding. The lovely rhythmic noise of the falls is enchanting. The road leading to the view points are quite winding but smooth as silk. Lovely road network. After visiting the Devon Falls from the view point, one can just go to the adjacent imposing Tea Castle to enjoy the tea and the wonderful view of the Falls area. We had our rented car and could go there easily.

This is a must see for anyone on their way to Nuwara Eliya. You can stop at the road side view point and enjoy a spectacular view while having the option of enjoying a picnic meal. This is an ideal stop for anyone on a long journey!
This falls can be viewed from the road and this looks like a silver streak cascading down the beautiful mountains. The view is very good
A must see sight if you are on the way to Nuwara Eliya. Even though it’s at a distance, can enjoy the view from the road. A nice place for a stopover and for a cup of tea and relax a bit.
After viewing the St. Clair's falls, we travelled a short distance further to see the Devon falls. Although the water levels were low, the height of the falls compensates for the lack of water.

One of the nice places in Sri Lanka to watch & experience the beauty of our Mother Land. It's a beautiful waterfall once & in a Certain period of the year the water really overflow the mountains. The Scenery can relax your mind & it will be a pill to your stress of driving.
Take some time stop for a cup of coffee and look at the wonderful view across the valley to the falls. It's beautiful and peaceful
Nice falls, especially after a rain.  Close to the road so easy to have a quick view without great effort.
Beautiful water fall can be seen on our way to Nuwara Eliya via Hatton. Very beautiful when the water level is high.

This is also situated near the St Clairs waterfall area.  It was a beautiful waterfall once now not so. In a Certain period of the year the water really overflow the mountains, it was a great site.but now it's not bad as the other one. You need a zoom lens to take close-ups, to get close to the falls will take more time unless you are an adventurist and a nature lover it's not worth the effort.
there are better views of waterfalls unless you get up close.  I would recommend spending more time at the St Claire waterfall which is in the same area.
We visited these falls when we were on our way from N.Eliya to Ella. Had an overnight in the Waterfall Villas from where you can see these falls .
When we visited this fall, the amount of natural water was low and so the falls had virtually dried up. I imagine it would be cute on a normal day.

We were driving along this road so it was not out of our way, but definitely worth stopping. We were in a middle of a wet spell so the fall was flowing well, and although we were quite a long way it was still a spectacualr sight
Our driver showed us these falls as one of his favourites and after heavy rain it was a great sight. Easy to view and worth the stop
Devon is a smaller water fall but worth a stop. It is a pity that it's only a trickle during the dry season as most of the forest cover above it has been cut down by the underworld gangs.

These falls are near Nuwara Elyia, they are high but narrow, and can be seen from far from a view point. It is a nice site and not far from St Claire's falls, so you can do both easily. I just couldn't get anywhere close to them. I wonder if that is even possible?
The sad part is, you really cant go near this place. You would have to make do with seeing it from the highway. Its quite scenic !
En route out of nuweriya eliya one can stop here for a quick view and photo . Pretty falls..just takes a few minutes. ..

Beautiful and narrow but tall waterfall. You can see it from the street. It is surrounded by greenaries. Opposite is St. Clair tea store where you can relax and enjoy a warm cup of tea. About 1-2 km from this waterfall is St Clair waterfall. So it is kind like 2 in 1 thing. You visit one place, you see 2 falls.

Situated by Hatton - Nuwara Eliya road tourists can easily observe this waterfall from the observation points. If one wants to get closer to the waterfall, take Nawalapitiya road from Dimbula junction. Can go near the top of the waterfall. Makes a great view through the tea estates.

Set in a very scenic area amongst the tea plantations. This is a large and beautiful waterfall where the torrent rushes over the edge and then tumbles down to the  bottom. I couldn't get close to the waterfall but used a zoom lens to get some good photos.
Devon Falls is one of the popular waterfalls in Sri Lanka ,if you need to give a break after trekking ,this place is oke.

This is very beautiful waterfall which can see on the road easily. There are a foot path to go the base of the waterfall but it is risky. There are many monkeys around the area and build 2 viewing points too.

The scene is as expected taken from paradise Nothing unusual Can be seen from far distance from outside terrace beside the road The scene combines a large lake in the right far the waterfall from the left far and another bigger waterfall from behind Amazing Recommended
While getting down from Nuwara Eliya, came across this at a turning point. Beautiful location. There is a tea house nearby so one can relax and enjoy the lovely view.
View point at Devon falls offers you a beautiful view of the falls. Good spot for photography. One the way sight seeing
they are two united falls, on a nice view. and a restaurant or a coffee shop. you can take many photos. and relax
Devon falls in the lush green valley of Nuwara eliya offer a nice view from the main road.  However it is quite far off and non-conspicuous. Can't catch very well in pics.

We stopped by this waterfall when we were returning from Nuwara Eliya to Hatton. You can simply stop you vehicle by the main road and enjoy the scenic view. When you are coming from Nuwara Eliya, once you pass St. Claire waterfall, you will come across sign boards of Devon estate. Just look around, you can view this from many places along the main road. You will be amazed by the scenic beauty.

Devon waterfall is stunning when seen against the lush green scenery of mountains covered with tea plantations with patches of inaccessible forests that probably haven't been touched since ancient times. The height of falls is just 97 metres but it looks wonderful. Sadly, this Devon Falls is going to be affected by a hydroelectric scheme that is going to vandalise 5 waterfalls in that beautiful area of Sri Lanka. It can be best viewed from 2 locations, one near the Mlesna Tea Center and the other opposite the St Clair Tea Center.
We stopped here on our way back to Colombo from Newara Eliya. There was beautiful scenery all along the route and this just added to it.

We stopped at a wayside tearoom, a bit quaint and bungalow-type shop.  We sat out on the front lawn overlooking the wonderful Devon Falls with tea in chins cups my grandmother used to use.  The tea was superb.  A great day all round.
Its a nice place to stop for a good photo.The tea factory MERSA  is near by,a must visit if not for buying tea than to sit in their restaurant and  sip tea.A must visit .
This is one of the most popular waterfall in Sri Lanka. Good location and you should see this waterfall.
We visited the location on our way to Nuwara Eliya. It's a breathtaking waterfall in the upcountry, surrounding by tea plantation. The terrain is rough, if you're going closure to the waterfall.
It is an amazing place to see, make sure to go and see the beauty of the naturr around the falls and tbe falls
An exotic waterfall along the Hatton Nuwara Eliya road.  On the opposite side there is the Mlesna Tea Center,
Nice charm place to spend some time on the way to Nuwara Eliya via Hatton road. You can park vehicle at the best view location and able take photos.
It was way too far to enjoy the view. Although it was a big fall but yet with this distance it did not fancied at all.

You'll find Devon falls on your way to Colombo from Nuwara Eliya. Picturesque backdrop with beautiful falls gives joy to your eyes. You can see the falls from the viewing point on the road which is really far from the falls. But the view is just fantastic and worth the stop.
no appropriate place to stand and take a nice picture. they should have a platform and some poles to support during photographing
We took a tuktuk to do both the tea factory and the waterfall (very close to each other). The waterfall is nice, not much people and a nice short walk with surrounding tea plantations.

You will be able to see this beautiful place when you travel from Hatton to Nuwaraeliya. Water fall is little far away. But you have a nice view from the view point near the road. It's a long water fall and is very beautiful when it's raining. There is a artist near the view point who draw nice art in front of you and he sale for very low price.
Stop by these falls en route to or from nearby Nuwara Eliya in Sri Lanka's beautiful central tea growing area. Especially spectacular after the monsoon rains.
We stopped at the Tea Bush restaurant on our way to Nuwara Eliya and took some great pictures of the Falls from distance and also of the reservoir at the Kotmale Dam

The waterfall is difficult to find and you may miss it. However, once you have found the place, you will love watch it. The only negative is, it is too far. The valley and the falls make an amazing view and if you go early in the morning, the weather is also pleasant.
We saw this water fall from  from the balcony of one restaurant situated on the high way. You see 3 water falls from this place and all were so good. There is no way t go near by.

On our way to Colombo from Nuwara Eliya, we stopped by the side of the road and stood on a viewing deck of the waterfall from a distance. It was quite a nice view where the waterfall gushed down a lush green background.

It's really worthy to visit Devon falls , one of the historic landmark of Nuwara Eliya. The waterfalls in a romantic row and it will touch your heart surely. Lots of photos we taken and always will remind me,.

The heights water falls Devan water falls was amazing the locals an tourist as well as. while looking at this place safety first, local sellers are selling local hand made items and painting crafts good to buy from them to encourage and in need of help.
on our way from Nuwara eliya to Colombo a halt been made at a place facing the Devon falls(97 m high), here there is a nice restaurant where you can have food and enjoy the view.
these are very beautiful falls in the midst of green lavish hills . we cannot reach there as it is a difficult path .
As u drive around this hilly area  you see many water falls . Specially after the rain falls . But they can be seen from  a distance . Few falls u can go near by but it is very tiring .
Another beautiful water fall which could be seen when traveling around the area...quite a walk to the place if you like a good hike..
You don't have to reach somewhere to see this. It is situated on the mid of the road from Nuwara Elya to Bentota.
I thought you can reach the fall and dip your feet in water. Though nothing close to it. You view the falls from a distance right on the express way though a good view.
When you reach there it is not immdtly seen but later you get to see good falls.. We were lucky to get a good sunset photo behind the falls
This just another water falls where there is little water. The scenery surrounding it is green and beautiful. There is a river or a lake running in the green hills and that looks magnificient.
A tea stop on the road at St Clair's afforded a nice view of the falls. Make sure you also see the St Clair falls just up the road.

It's beautiful and breathtaking. The water can be seen from far but it has beautiful, refreshing green surrounding. I felt so fresh and energetic staying here for some time. I enjoyed my visit to Sri Lanka. Very peaceful place very friendly people. It seems they only smile and welcome tourist in their land. I simply loved it .. wil surely visit again some times.
Stopped off on our tour for photos of this waterfall. Very impressive sight, but a few other buses and minivans visit as well. Ok when quite!
Devon falls another stop en route to Hatton is a waterfall that has remained as it was. A visit to the nearby tea cafe adds to the flavour of the stop.
Since I am from the place where there are lots of water falls, personally I did not find this waterfall so great. This is just another fall as per my opinion.
Stopped off en route between Nuwara Eliya and Bentota. Quick photo opportunity. Lots of others doing the same thing.
Not that impressive after seeing St Clair. It's a long way away and very thin. Could be better in monsoon season.
Great for photos, and you only need a few minutes. Easily done on the way from Kandy to Nuwara Eliya.
This beautiful waterfall can be seen from the Hatton Nuwaraeliya road. There is a interesting place along the road to see this waterfall.
Those who all are nature lover it's a must go destination for them. You'll found peach and serenity. I went their with my wife and found it very pleasant.
...it is a waterfall. From the road between Hatton and Nuwara Eliya you'll pass by a few falls. Devon falls is one of the waterfalls with less water. However still nice to watch.
Could only view the falls from the viewing place on the main road.  Worth stopping and taking a photo or two
Visited this awesome site on the way to Nuwara Eliza and walked thru the jungles to experience the beauty of Sri Lanka.
one can not get near to fall. just viewing from a view point. caople of waterfalls nearby. part of waterfall trip.
I saw the picking of the tea leaves, beautiful terraced hills, cultivated with style. Saw beautiful scenery, cool temperatures in a hot country.
Beauty surrounds you to and from this area of Sri-Lanka. Good for keen photographer's and painter's alike, even Tea tasting.

Devon Falls is named after a pioneer English coffee planter called Devon, whose plantation is situated nearby the falls. The Waterfall is 281 ft. high and ranked 19th highest in the Island. The Falls are formed by waters of Kothmale Oya, a tributary of Mahveli River. It is an awesome waterfall and can be seen while driving from Kandy to Nuwara.

We had a look at Devon Falls from the Melsna tea castle and it is marvellous. Surrounded by lush green tea estates the falls is a must see stop when one is traversing via the Nuwara Elia. In Nuwara Elya there is also a viewing podium from where you can click pictures. Lies on the roadside between the Melsna Tea Castle and the Mackwoods Tea Estates
A quick stop over on the side of the road just to see Devon Falls and take a few pictures with it. A white line that compliment with the green trees.
Devon is a thin tall line. But nice to watch. Specially the view points are nice to get down and spend some time.
Travelling from Nuwara Eliya to Galle Fort, Devon Falls is one of many waterfalls that can be viewed along the route.

Devon Falls is a beautiful road side cascade will come across when you travel from Thalawakele town to Hatton. (closer to Thalawakele town and after St.Clairs falls). There are several view points to view this beauty. One is situated in front of Devon bungalow and other one is in front of Mlesna tea castle. Third view point is at Pathana junction. When you go down along the Kovil entrance at Pathana junction, you can have nice front view. You can reach the top of the waterfall by travelling along in Nawalapitiya road from Pathana junction. Better visit in rainy days.
This place is especially for photography lovers, it has a nice spectecular view of falls. This is not a big place or spot but it's on the way therefore worth visiting to see nice falls.
one of the biggest waterfalls I saw in the area. Stop by on oposite site to have tea and watch it from a distance
We couldn't get a closer look. Had the long ranged gaze and it was amazing more than how it looked in photos. A meditating fantasy I must say!
Beautiful waterfall very close to St Clairs Waterfall. But very far from the road, you need to have a camera with good zoom.
Oh so beautiful these and many of the other Falls are we see on our driving, great for a photo and a much enjoyed stop.
very nice place but its not cheap its expensive so you will find same the brand tea (ceylon tea) in the downtown shopping center cheap than the factory price
The waterfall is far from the highway, but if you're satisfied with pictures, you'll just need a camera with a good zoom. The scenery around it is very beautiful.
devon falls in enroute to nuwara eliya from kandy..you can watch from your vehicle also..scenery around is beautiful
Its the highest waterfall I had seen in Srilanka I estimate its height 500 meters nice to see this landmark
one of the beautiful waterfalls in the country. Unfortunately could not go closer to the waterfall but enjoyed the beauty of it from the main road.

You will see this from the road on the way up to Nuwara Eliya. There are a number of places you can stop and see it from across the valley. According to our guide, April is the best time to visit this region and we went in April and were very lucky with the weather. The area is covered in tea plantations and it is only by visiting this area I realized that every single tea leaf is picked by hand - quite incredible and humbling to watch.
very beautiful place . THere is a place called TEa castle in front of it. must eat there. wow view .
Excellent view from the road-side, in several places. The falls are scenic and provide a very good photo opportunity. The intensity of the water-flow would, of course, depend on the rains.
It's worth a stop to take a look at as you drive by but being so far away you can't really take it in properly which is a shame.
viewed from far as we were driving back to colombo. it is on same road as St Clair's. St Clair waterfall is better :)
The road side viewing are was not very crowded. The view was grate. Just few hundred metres ahead is the St Clare's falls.

Devan falls is one of the beautiful waterfalls in the central hills in Sri Lanka on the main highway A7.  Its not a biggest fall still, it could be a good stop between Nuwara Eliya & Hatton if you are traveling on your own and could be missed if anyone using public transport. The view from the highway is perfect and I visitors can enjoy freh freh high land tea in the adjoining tea boutique.
This is another waterfall we see on our way to Nuwara eliya through the Hatton road. THis water fall is also visible to the main road.
The best place to view this fall is from the Mlesna Tea Center while taking a break and enjoying a hot cup of tea. The fall is located very close to the St. Clair Falls on the way to Nuwara Eliya.
not acssable by road, thus road track to fall is imperative. looks o.k from distance, not so good. provide tourist facility

such an elegant scenery.. i have been here quit a few times,,, always like you are seeing from the 1st time.. location given you a refreshing feeling... most of the time bit misty and wet climate... which i love the most :)
beautiful scenery. lovely to stop & see , but not necessarily to stay Heritage Tea factory hotel close & a lovely place to spend a night or two.

There are some worldwide famous falls like Niagara, Iguaçu and Victoria falls; then you have hundred and hundred falls in all place of the world that are just... falls. St. Clair's Falls (almost in front of the St. Clair's Tea Factory) and Devon falls are just two more falls.

It's nice to stop to watch this amazing view on the way to Nuwara Ella, we walked down the hill to be as close to the water fall and the view was amazing. To go down its very steep so make sure you are wearing a good shoes.
Thee falls on the way to KITUGULA near St clir tea estates can be seen from the Road side. There was no rains and the falls to proportionately decresed during our visit in MARCH 2015.
Excellent fall. Must see and visit. We visited on our way from nuwara Eliya to bentota. Very nice view
Excellent waterfall, especially after the past few days heavy rain. A little way off the beaten track but well wort the visit. Give yourself a little time to just sit and enjoy it.
Majestic is all I can say and the location around it is beautiful. The travel to this place is really tiring and you should keep atleast half a day dedicated to the falls. A good experience.

Devon Falls is a waterfall in Sri Lanka, situated 6 km west of Talawakele, Nuwara Eliya District on A7 highway. The falls is named after a pioneer English coffee planter called Devon, whose plantation is situated nearby the falls. The Waterfall is 97 meters high and ranked 19th highest in the Island. Location :Talawakele, Sri Lanka height :97m Watercourse :Kothmale Oya very nearby you can see another beautiful waterfall named St. Clairs. So if you go via this road you can see two of the most beatiful water falls in sri lanka
lovely waterfall in verdant green highland scenery surrounded by tea plantations, winding roads and vertiginous canyons
Good to visit for a short time. You feel relaxed and take a cup of coffee from the nearby shop. Enjoy the scenery and take some photos.
If you are a nature lover,this place is very nice to visit,you can watch this waterfall with a super view from front of the tea castle

One of the Waterfalls that easily reachable in island of Sri Lanka. Situated just along the Thalawakele - Hatton main road that every one can visit using a vehicle or public transport. If you coming by train, from Thalawakele station you need to catch a bus or a tuk tuk to reach this place. You can see the St. Clair waterfall too but its on dead state with newly build dam in Kothmale.
The water fall itself is nice however, i wish and hope that government can make it much safer trekking to the devon's fall.

If you visit Sri Lanka this should be place to visit. Devon Falls is situated in Talawakele, Nuwara Eliya District. The falls is named after a pioneer English coffee planter called Devon, whose plantation is situated nearby the falls. The Waterfall is 97 metres high. Plan on visiting Devon's and St Clair waterfall on the same day as they are situated in the same area. You can expect cooler climate in this area so be ready with rain jackets/umbrella or a spring jacket. Right in front of the place where you park the vehicle you will find a restaurant with delicious Ceylon tea, cakes and rolls (spicy but great).
The falls could be observed from the newly improved observation point opposite the Devon bungalow. It is anice view.
I would not drive out of your way to see this waterfall.  It is on the side of the road.  The one at Horton Plains is more impressive.
A beautiful waterfall  The rocks were awesome and we could not stop taking pictures just to capture the essence to take home with us during the long winter months in glasgow
It was a picturesque drive from Nuwara Eliya to Bentota. The falls were a delight to watch with the lush greenery all around.

Travelling from Nuwara Eliya to Colombo on A7 we came across this beautiful waterfall that plunges down to the valley below in three continuous cascades. The waterfall is the 19th tallest waterfall in Sri Lanka and it is 97 meters high. The best place to view the waterfall is the clearly marked area by the side of the main road. A closer look can be had from the nearby Melsna tea Castle while sipping a cup of delicious Ceylon Tea. Not very far from Devon is the widest water fall in Sri lanka St. Clairs fall.
You will find Devon fall when you travel from Colombo to N'Eliya via Ginigathena road. It can be observed from the main road, no need to turn anywhere as Google Maps would incorrectly suggest :-)

Devon Falls is a waterfall and viewing point on the A7 out of Nuwara Eliya towards Hatton. The road was being widened when we travelled it and was in quite unbelievably bad condition, with roadworks stretching some 20km and parts of the road no more than a muddy, rutted track. Somewhat disconcertingly, behind you as you look out at the waterfall there is a Victorian tea room - this is actually the Devon Tea Centre, which we didn't visit. Just along the road is the Mlesna Tea Castle, a very strange building which we also passed by. Other than that, it's a waterfall. A very nice waterfall, but a waterfall for all that...

looks beautiful from the road we were travelling on. did not go to visit it though as it was raining the day we planned to go. looks beautiful to the eyes and no camera can capture the sight and sound of the same!!!
